intro: Pseudo-acacia halodendron, commonly known as the desert false acacia, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and feathery leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant has a deep root system, allowing it to access groundwater in dry conditions. It is well adapted to saline soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall. Its resilience makes it an important component of desert ecosystems.
